glsa.title: Varnish: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Improper input validation in Varnish allows remote attackers to conduct HTTP smuggling attacks, and possibly trigger a buffer overflow.

background.p: Varnish is a web application accelerator.

description.p: Varnish fails to properly validate input from HTTP headers, and does not deny requests with multiple Content-Length headers.

impact.p: Remote attackers could conduct an HTTP response splitting attack, which may further enable them to conduct Cross-Site Scripting (XSS), Cache Poisoning, Defacement, and Page Hijacking.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
